pullRequest.body:
Adds two results on the Localization for CommMonoids: one, describes exactly when the localization map is injective, the 
other essentially says that the localization of a cancellative Monoid is cancellative if the localization is injective. 

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: Note that I do not really know how to use the review interface properly and some of the diffs above are not correct.

> Here and elsewhere you should add spaces

I hope I added all the appropriate spaces....

:v: XavierXarles can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I have the impression you really like to make a lot of intermediate statement using `have`: I've nothing against it in general, but is there a specific reason you don't finish the proof like this?
```lean
  -- The hypothesis `h` gives that `f` (so, `g`) is injective, and we can cancel out `b.1`.
  have : b.1 * (y.1 * x.2) =  b.1 * (x.1 * y.2) :=
      (LocalizationMap.toMap_injective_iff fl).mpr h this
  rw [mul_comm, ← IsLeftCancelMulZero.mul_left_cancel_of_ne_zero b1ne0 this, mul_comm]
```
Another stylistic comment: I think `rw [a, b, c]` is more readable than `rw [a,b,c]`, can you please check the spaces? Thanks!

> ✌️ XavierXarles can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7478457615/job/20353464550)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7478457615/job/20353464841)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7478457615/job/20353464162)
Here and elsewhere you should add spaces

Just a final stylistic comment: can you avoid having three intermediate results all called `this`? Lean seems to be good in understanding which one to use (or maybe it uses the last one, I am not sure), but this looks like a code smell.

Thanks!

bors d+

```suggestion ← mul_assoc a,mul_assoc _ z,mul_assoc z] ```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
theorem toMap _injective_iff {f : LocalizationMap S N} :
```
Why do you propose that name? It is a bit confusing for me the names to use.

My reasoning here is that:
* You're talking about injectivity of `f.toMap`, so it should be `toMap_injective_something` or `injective_toMap_something` (we tend to prefer the former for predicates like `Injective`, `Surjective`, `Monotone`...)
* It is primarily about `LocalizationMap`, so it should be in namespace `LocalizationMap`
* Actually, `LocalizationMap.toMap_injective` is ambiguous, since it could refer to injectivity of `LocalizationMap.toMap` (instead of `f.toMap`) and indeed it already does, so probably `toMap_injective_iff` is better.

The reason `CanLift` even exists is that there is a corresponding tactic that does all this for you!
```suggestion
    lift x to S using hx
```

```suggestion
  · intro x hx y z hyz
    simp_rw [LocalizationMap.eq_iff_exists] at h
```

```suggestion
/-- Given a localization map `f : M →*₀ N` for a submonoid `S ⊆ M`,
```

This is a weird statement. The docstring doesn't seem to correspond to the Lean statement, and I would have expected something like
```suggestion
/-- Given a Localization map `f : M →*₀ N` for a Submonoid `S ⊆ M`,
`f 0 * (f y)⁻¹ = 0` for any `y : M` -/
theorem eq_zero_of_fst_eq_zero (f : LocalizationWithZeroMap S N)
    {z} {y : S} : z * f y = 0 ↔ z = 0 := (f.toLocalizationMap.map_units' y).mul_left_eq_zero
```
which shows you that probably you don't need that lemma at all

The reason I put this lemma is because it exists a version for IsLocalization for Semirings in [IsLocalization.eq_zero_of_fst_eq_zero](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Localization/Basic.html#IsLocalization.eq_zero_of_fst_eq_zero). But I agree when I was trying to describe I was not sure about it...
Meh, honestly I wouldn't bother about it (and would even remove `IsLocalization.eq_zero_of_fst_eq_zero`)

I removed that result and modified the proof of the next result accordingly. I am not very happy about the way I wrote it: because I don't know how to write it in a short way, may be since some inferences (?) are not done automatically... Anyway, I hope the proof is clear.

```suggestion
    (h : ∀ ⦃x⦄, x ∈ S → IsLeftRegular x) : IsLeftCancelMulZero N := by
```

```suggestion
```


```suggestion
      simp_rw [OneMemClass.coe_one, one_mul]
```

You should not use nonterminal `simp` in general.
The calc proof is quite long with a lot of steps. Maybe you should consider merging several lines into one unless you think it makes the proof harder to follow

```suggestion
if `M` is a cancellative monoid with zero, and all elements of `S` are
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion use 1 ```
Can you use `cases` instead of `cases'` ?
Yes, I can. But, pardon my ignorance, ¿is it preferable?
I could use also  `obtain ⟨b, hb ⟩ := LocalizationMap.surj fl a `
Yes, `cases'` (and all the various `tac'`) is from Lean3, but sooner or later it will disappear. See for example #9171 .
I changed, but with obtain, which I like more...
That's perfect, thanks!
Does starting with `intro hb1` instead of `by_contra hb1` work here?

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion obtain ⟨b, hb ⟩ := LocalizationMap.surj fl a obtain ⟨x, hx ⟩ := LocalizationMap.surj fl z obtain ⟨y, hy ⟩ := LocalizationMap.surj fl w ```

```suggestion
  let fl := f.toLocalizationMap
  let g := f.toMap
  constructor
  intro a z w ha hazw
  obtain ⟨b, hb⟩ := LocalizationMap.surj fl a
  obtain ⟨x, hx⟩ := LocalizationMap.surj fl z
  obtain ⟨y, hy⟩ := LocalizationMap.surj fl w
  rw [(LocalizationMap.eq_mk'_iff_mul_eq fl).mpr hx,
    (LocalizationMap.eq_mk'_iff_mul_eq fl).mpr hy, LocalizationMap.eq]
  use 1
  rw [OneMemClass.coe_one, one_mul, one_mul]
  -- The hypothesis `a ≠ 0` in `P` is equivalent to this
  have b1ne0 : b.1 ≠ 0 := by
    intro hb1
    have m0 : (LocalizationMap.toMap fl) 0 = 0 := f.map_zero'
    have a0 : a * (LocalizationMap.toMap fl) b.2 = 0 ↔ a = 0 :=
      (f.toLocalizationMap.map_units' b.2).mul_left_eq_zero
    rw [hb1, m0, a0] at hb
    exact ha hb
  -- Main equality that is deduced from `a * z = a * w`
  have : g (b.1 * (y.1 * x.2)) = g (b.1 * (x.1 * y.2)) :=
    calc
      g (b.1 * (y.1 * x.2)) = g b.1 * g (y.1 * x.2) := map_mul g _ _
      _ = a * g b.2 * (w * g y.2 * g x.2) := by rw[map_mul g,hb,hy]
      _ = a * w * g b.2 * (g y.2 * g x.2) := by
        rw[← mul_assoc _ _ _,← mul_assoc _ w _,mul_assoc a _ w,
          mul_comm _ w,mul_assoc,← mul_assoc a w _]
      _ = a * z * g b.2 * (g y.2 * g x.2) := by rw [hazw]
      _ = a * g b.2 * (z * g x.2 *g y.2) := by
        rw [mul_comm (g y.2), mul_assoc a z, mul_comm z,
          ← mul_assoc a, mul_assoc _ z, mul_assoc z]
      _ = g (b.1 * (x.1 * y.2)) := by rw [hx, hb, map_mul g, ← map_mul g]
    -- The hypothesis `h` gives that `f` (so, `g`) is injective.
  have : b.1 * (y.1 * x.2) =  b.1 * (x.1 * y.2) :=
      (LocalizationMap.toMap_injective_iff fl).mpr h this
  -- The hypothesis to be left cancellative allows us to cancel `b.1`
  have : (y.1 * x.2) = (x.1 * y.2) :=
    IsLeftCancelMulZero.mul_left_cancel_of_ne_zero b1ne0 this
  rw [mul_comm, ← this, mul_comm]
```
This is literally your proof, but instead of `have mul_cancel` and `exact {}` at the end I use `constructor`, so the goal became exactly the statement of your `mul_cancel`.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw[mul_assoc a, mul_comm z, ← mul_assoc a, mul_assoc, mul_assoc z] _ = g b.1 * g (y.2 * x.1) := by rw [hx, hb, mul_comm (g x.1), ← map_mul g] _ = g (b.1 * (y.2 * x.1)):= by rw [← map_mul g] ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion exact (IsLeftCancelMulZero.mul_left_cancel_of_ne_zero b1ne0 ```

lacking some spaces here; maybe fix in your next PR
```
    [IsCancelMulZero M] (h : ∀ ⦃x⦄, x ∈ S → IsRegular x) : IsCancelMulZero N := by
  have : IsLeftCancelMulZero N :=
```
